Multiplayer is what you would expect, the better you get at the game the sweatier the opponents you face thanks to skill based matchmaking, the bane of multiplayer games. Most of us come home from work and want to unwind, not get thrown into a fucking E-Sports lobby filled with people on Jobseeker's allowance. That have nothing to contribute to society other than their win/loss ratio.

I've been plagued with connection issues from day one, random disconnects for no fucking reason at all. Packet loss etc. 2024 and we still have bullshit issues that are present due to likely copy pasting the game.

All the guns are fake, Activision are so tight they can't even licence real weapons.

Microtransactions galore, it's a storefront with a game added on. Not going to lie, i'd buy the Nicki Minaj skin if they ever re released it. Just to see dat badonk badonk.

Zombies is slightly fun if not repetitive, oh and if you get dropped or D/C say goodbye to your loot, guns, equipment. Might as well just kill yourself too that's how hard a reset you're given.

Anyway, kind of enjoy playing it. But i'll give it a 0/10 because of Activision being cunts.

i recommend mw2 when its on sale just bc the game feels leagues better than mw3. i got mw3 when it was 30% off and even that felt like a rip off. i play off an ethernet connection which only has my phone, switch, and steamdeck hooked up to it along with my pc. the switch and steamdeck are off which only leaves my pc. my internet is not like crazy good, i usually get 300 down and 50-75 upl. but thats ONLY BEING USED by my desktop pc. despite that i rubberband all the time. either its like small jitters or im all over the place. it feels as if every game is a platformer ice level and youll just slide around at times. the zombies was kinda neat, it felt difficulty which is nice because i consider myself pretty good at zombies and my first and only game of it i carried someone through extraction. but with the connection issues, and the amount of sweatiness that comes from this game makes it hard to recommend. i played like 5 mp matches and only won one and the the one i won i got the lease amount of kills in lol. so uhhhh honestly dont buy either of these games. if u want a good cod zombies thats new, get cold war. if you want really good zombies buy bo3. if u want classic but really good zombies get cod waw, bo1, or bo2. if u want a good multiplayer that isnt dead ur kinda out of luck. buy battlefield 5 or maybe move on from this genre entirely.

edit: 96 hours following review I was riddled with direct x crashes making ranked unplayable. thios developed in to being unable to start the game, kernel-power issues on PC all the sudden (only with this game). Reinstalled the game, deleted and reinstalled direct x files, reinstalled windows, verified game files, reinstalled new drivers and deleted old, updated windows, attempted to run game as admin with no solution. took it to a shop, first time thats been necessary for me- and they were unable to fix it after almost a week. ended up reinstalling windows and got the game to finally start, this time with C++ erorrs on load. safe mode doesn't help. two days since picking pc up from shop, swapping components to a massive upgrade with no fix. Tonnnns of crashes now related to direct x again, despite no errors found when running dxdiag. 

TLDR: game is optimized to shit, and guys at shop (which is highly rated) said half their business lately is due to COD issues following December updates.

"Your Profile has been signed out" is basically what I paid to see on an hourly basis while playing. According to Activision it's my network but according to my dedicated server uptime on the same network Activision is full of shit. Despite my multiple attempts to work the issue out and handful of Youtube videos send to them showing the issue happening with absolutely no packet loss, they refuse to help. When it's not my profile being signed out it's a DirectX error that they've already fixed twice before but magically is still there.

I hear the term "Small Indie Company" quite a bit when referring to a AAA title with issues but thinking about it... I don't remember the last "Small Indie Company" game that I had this many issues with. Food for thought.

Basically, game's dog water. Go spend your money on a fleshlight or something you'll get more use out of. You're welcome.

This Call of Duty does a great job of capturing the fun I had playing MW2 as a teenager, while still offering many of the desirable qualities that from previous titles. The customization options cosmetics and for load outs is at the best spot its ever been in the franchise. The battle pass is worth purchasing and still worth while even if you don't purchase the battle pass. The skill based matchmaking can be annoying at times but each game feels competitive which is something I personally like. It feels like people play to win, even in pubs and that's refreshing in my opinion. Choosing to remake the original MW2's maps was brilliant and honestly overdue. I still enjoy them none the less. Overall, great Call of Duty title.

For me, two essential elements for COD MW3 to become a great first person shooter is maps and weapons. I don't play the single player campaign, so I cannot comment on it, but the feedback I heard is it sucked. Gun play for the multiplayer, in my opinion is better than MW2. weapons feel faster, sound better and operator movement is quicker. I agree that for $70 minimum cost  MW3 should have been A DLC. Whoever Dev's are left working at COD that wasnt fired after microsoft took over doesn't seem to know or prioritize the development of good new maps, that is why they are bringing back tons of maps from MW2 such as Breenbergh Hotel, Scrapyard and Shoothouse which are good, but this is a stand alone new product and not acceptable. This is season 2 and my point is being proven in almost every round I play, when It comes down to voting on map play, the MW2 maps win in selection over the "spectacular new maps just released" for the new season. Release a DLC and advertise it as MW3 and make 70 to 100 dollars of us players, no more pre-purchase for me. If you already own MW2 please wait for this to go on deep discount, it's season 2 and I haven't seen anything to justify this price tag.

MW3 2ème edit (112h de jeu) (1er edit à 50h) :
Les anciens bons points qui ont changé :
- le slide encore bugué (dès fois je cours et j'essaies de slide, mais le jeu prend pas mes inputs.... bizarre) mais le feeling des gun est bon, dynamique
- moins d'fps qu'avant (entre 220 - 315 fps selon les maps), maintenant c'est entre 220 - 280)
- bonne visibilité de base (que tu peux améliorer dans tes paramètres de cg)

Les bons points :
- bonne visibilité de base (que tu peux améliorer dans tes paramètres de cg)
- le feeling est bon
- des petites maps sont arrivées, on peut mieux se défouler maintenant (ils sont pas oufs mais ça passe)
- ils ont nerf le weapon sway sur les armes (c'est une bonne nouvelle pour les joueurs clavier/souris)

Les mauvais points qui ont pas changé :
- ttk est toujours super inconsistant (dès fois t'as l'impression de mettre 3 balles et dès fois 10)
- les serveurs sont toujours vraiment à chier (packet burst presque à chaque game)
- l'input clavier souris est toujours très très bizarre, juste un peu plus fluide qu'avant
- les maps grandes sont nostalgiques, c'est cool, mais elles sont pas adaptées au gameplay dynamique que nous offre le jeu (maps à grosse campouze)
- l'EOMM (c'est pas du SBMM) qui a pas changé et qui me met encore avec des bots recrues mais j'affronte des tryhards aussi chauds que moi, imbuvable, je peux même pas jouer avec mes potes... enlevez ça par pitié, parce-que là vous pouvez pas vous plaindre des personnes qui RB, c'est le seul moyen pour avoir un peu de fun sur le jeu.

Résumé :
- Si l'EOMM vous embête pas et que vous aimez les maps, prenez le jeu, sinon, attendez des réducs ou carréments des patchs.

This is nothing but a cash grab... CoD ins't the same anymore. SBMM ruined the multiplayer experience, bugs EVERYWHERE, and the Hulu based UI is mind numbing. This isn't worth $70, it's literally a small DLC to MW2 (2022) that brought back maps from the OG MW2. Zombies is honestly just a re-branded DMZ with a couple of zombies, which no one really liked to be honest. An overwhelming majority of the player base likes round based anyways. If Activision really cared about its fan base, they would listen to our feedback instead of shoving hundreds of terrible micro-transactions in your face as soon as you open the game, a half baked campaign that's 3 hours long and makes no sense whatsoever. MW3 is just poor attempt of nostalgia slapping MW3 on it. It's nothing like MW3 (2011). Save your money, buy something else or just wait for Xdefient to finally come out, the beta for that was MUCH more fun and enjoyable than CoD in recent years. PLUS, the developers who made MW2 (2009) and MW3 (2011) are making it so just hold out till then. 2/10.

Whether it's several frighteningly realistic depictions of terrorism in the rather short campaign (with the familiar Call of Duty formula of regenerating health and two weapons you can swap out, interspersed with campaign missions that allow you to complete it whether guns blazing or dead silent), a solid multiplayer mode, an addictive Battle Royale mode or a calming zombies mode (if you stay away from the high threat zones or the cutscenes; those can cause fear), this game is above-average (4.70/5.00)

It's not perfect because some elements may have been left out due to this game having live-service features.

game sucks

Fun in doses but frustrating a lot of the time due to skill based matchmaking putting you into unwinnable games, horrible spawns especially on small maps (people spawning behind you all the time, being spawned into crossfires and immediately dying, being spawned with a guy right in front and unable to react so no chance to win the fight, predictable spawns for snipers), cheese weapons (riot shields, spammable grenade launchers, unstoppable knifing due to mechanics of speed), cheating epidemic on PC (honestly UAV jamming stuff seems useless a lot of the time), meta guns being OP compared to most weapons, 1 shot snipers pretty much anywhere on the body, 1 shot pistols and shotguns from mid range, quick scoping 1 shot snipers that can basically instant fire (KVD, Longbow), kill streaks being oppressive on small maps, hit box of throwing knives and grenades is wonky and too large a lot of the time, multitude of bugs (at time of writing the assassin vest has a bug without being able to equip a lethal was confirmed not supposed to happen, been days and not fixed), inability to play maps a person likes, terrible single player campaign, forced to look at kill screen after match (why can't I just leave?), forcing me to look at battle pass after every game, putting the default FOV at 80 (move it to at least 100, thank me later, why the default is basically a detriment is beyond me), having to level up other guns to get attachments for the gun I like, definitely more stuff I haven't listed. Honestly feels like a money grab for cosmetic revenue and honestly more frustrating than fun - it's hard to have a good time when you die without being able to react 3-4 times in a row many games. Redeeming qualities are movement and mechanics feel smooth and the guns are cool - that's about it. And you get a dopamine rush still when playing.

Your life will honestly be better if you just stay away - sad to see that this is what this franchise has become. Honestly a cosmetic money grab rather than a balanced, solid, fun game. I only play it because I enjoyed the the nostalgia of good times with friends and the dopamine rush in spurts and wanted something to do over the cold winter but that's even hard nowadays especially at the start of Season 2. Better off saving your money.

The game is great, the problem is trying to have fun at first is very difficult and only having 3-4 guns after 13 hrs of play is insane and frustrating. I had a lot of fun with CoD mobile and didn't want to burn my eyeballs on a little screen and wanted more serious competition but it feels like the only level playing field is team gun. I'd recommend this game but it isn't worth that price for a game that requires such dedication of your time before you can really have fun with it.

Call of Duty is a mixed bag of really Positive highs, and Terrible lows. It remains to my knowledge as the most consistent high profile franchise to last these many years. It does this through unmatched Gun play and fluidity. So much so, that discourse between players often comes down to minor changes between games that would see much less criticisms from other games players. Regardless what title you play, your in for some Smooth, well crafted game play.

What Drags it all down, is its incredibly predatory business practices, often putting much more time and effort into getting you to spend money, then providing meaningful content. It has figured out the perfect rhythm to keep the drip feed tolerable, and while everyone is different, those who continue to play release after release act like they have Stockholm syndrome.

The game is not bad but it 100% is not good. First of all the Campaign was extremely short, one of the shortest Call of Duty Campaign out there, Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 was 10 hours Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 was 9 hours: Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 was only 5 hours long. The developers that were complaining on Twitter when Christopher Judge the voice of Kratos called them out at the game awards for the game being too short should just all shut up. They spent more time making the microtransactions for this game than they did making longer stories and better content. 

The story itself is a joke. The fact that they ran out of story ideas and now they are relying on remastering the old story and changing the story just a little bit is a joke. 

The PvP sucks. It's not as bad as Destiny 2 PvP but it's still pretty bad. In almost every game mode you have to deal with enemy teams with big mouths and small brains and everyone does the same repetitive trash things jumpshoting, proning, sliding, spawn manipulation, and grenade launchers: if I had a nickel for every time I've heard a grenade launcher be used in a match I'd be a multi-millionaire by now: also abusing overpowered weapons like automatic shotguns with thermite rounds pretty much scumbags doing the scummiest things imaginable because they're bad and they need crutches like that to try to win fights. So yes, the PvP is extremely terrible, and skill-based matchmaking and spawn locations are poorly designed. 

The biggest part of the franchise, the zombie’s part has been pretty much overlooked. They recently released a battle pass season that's all about zombies and they didn't make any changes to MWZ they really should add more stories to MWZ and more content but they're not either because they're lazy or they don't care. It's funny that they're doing the same stereotype that Epic Games did with their zombie game mode Save the World. The legitimate only reason why I even bought this game in the 1st place was for the zombies, there's not even a round-based zombie game mode. If they don't add any new content to any of the zombie stuff, I'm just going to uninstall the game because zombies are what made Call of Duty what it is today, not PvP the two things that made Call of Duty what it is was the amazing story and the zombies game mode and both of those right now are extremely lackluster. 

Truthfully, in my opinion, none of the developers behind this game should be in the gaming industry anymore. It's easy to tell that they probably cheated all their university exams to graduate because when you look at how crappy this game is and how it's just a cash grab for money and they put as little effort into as possible putting things like skin collecting and weapon leveling as content when all it is is just blatant repetitive farming that's very easy to develop. What they really should have done was make a better and bigger story instead of the ingame store. This game could have been amazing, but it is just a mediocre cash grab from Activision as usual. I would love to see Activision go bankrupt for all the horrible things they've done to the gaming industry and cod but that's never going to happen because too many people voted with their wallets. P.T. Barnum once said, There's a sucker born every minute and that's why Activision has been alive for this long.

Loved the OG maps that are timeless and designed well.  The kill streaks were present but weren't disruptive to just the experience of a good fast paced shooter.  Then the "seasons" started, and they progressively broke everything. I was already one foot out the door because of the matchmaking not favoring connection over whatever system it uses, this was the final straw.  This game just isn't worth your time so don't waste your money.

Didn't think I'd have to review two games in the save review, but Call of Duty has made some interesting choices. So here it goes.

02/12/2024 MW3 may look the same, but it plays infinitely better. The movement and perk mechanics far surpass the clunky way they handle in MW2, and as an added bonus, they brought back War Mode and added MWZ. If you've played MW2 I'm not sure it's worth buying, but if you haven't. It's a pretty solid COD game as of this review's date.
Never again......

MW3 has great movement and decent gun play. However, the maps are horrid. There seems to be three-story buildings on just about every map or multiple two-story buildings that people put up a camp-sight in and just gun you down. There's maps like Highrise where you had better not go down middle unless you want someone who stayed in spawn with a long range weapon and scope to gun you down (but of course there is ALWAYS and objective right smack in the middle). Gone are the days of players sprinting around full speed with SMGs and ARs and getting in exhilarating gunfights. The maps are just soooooo bad and camping is rewarded so highly, that if you're a run and gunner, you may as well not play. Zombies looks fun, but every time i go to match-make, it can't find people to play with until the search expands to the 200-ish ping ranges. I can't speak for Warzone, because I haven't tried it. One last note on how terrible the maps are...as someone who played the heck out of 24/7 Shipment in MW2, seeing Terminal as the 24/7 map in MW3 really puts the final nail in the coffin.

Mi experiencia con este juego ha sido menos que satisfactoria, especialmente para aquellos que son nuevos en la serie. Mi último juego de Call of Duty fue Infinity Warfare, y aunque compré este por nostalgia, no lo recomendaría para NADA a los jugadores novatos. En el modo multijugador, te enfrentarás constantemente a jugadores de nivel superior a 200, lo cual es extremadamente injusto y frustrante. Estos jugadores ya poseen las mejores armas, accesorios, habilidades y ventajas, mientras que tú solo cuentas con el equipo inicial. 10/10

Lackluster Gameplay: The gameplay feels stale and uninspired, like it's recycling the same tired mechanics from years ago. It's as if the developers are just going through the motions, offering nothing innovative or exciting to keep players engaged.

Glitch Fest: I've encountered more bugs and glitches in this game than I can count. From characters getting stuck in walls to weapons disappearing mid-firefight, the experience is riddled with frustrating technical issues that should have been ironed out long before release.

Pay-to-Win Microtransactions: COD used to be about skill and strategy, but now it seems like the only way to get ahead is by shelling out more cash. The game is inundated with pay-to-win microtransactions that give paying players a significant advantage, making it feel more like a cash grab than a fair competition.

Bland Storyline: The single-player campaign, once a highlight of the franchise, is now nothing more than a forgettable, paint-by-numbers experience. The storyline lacks depth and originality, failing to captivate or immerse players in any meaningful way.

Toxic Community: Perhaps the most disappointing aspect of all is the toxic community that has taken root within the game. From rampant cheating to constant harassment, playing COD online has become a cesspool of negativity that sours the experience for everyone involved.

ACTIVISION: PLEASE EMPLOY PROPER QA TESTING STAFF, BECAUSE YOUR GAME IS BUGGY AS HELL. 

Seriously, this game has SO MUCH potential to be one of their best. MWZ is by far the most interesting zombies, but is so riddled with bugs and so punishing to the player when one is encountered that it's actually mind-blowing. 

Here's a couple examples: 
 - When you complete an aether extractor mission at the exact same second that the timer runs out, you get eliminated. No calling for help, no going down, just dead.
 - When you use the scorcher multiple times in a row to fly, and it lags for a sec, you will hit the ground and go down at the exact moment the second charge goes off, launching your downed body into the air, which will then eliminate you as soon as your land. No requesting help, just eliminated, round over, stuff lost.
 
There are MANY MORE, but these are just the ones that have happened to me in the past few weeks. It wouldn't be that big of a deal if the game didn't punish the player so heavily for this. Losing all your inventory, loadout, everything, is a waste of several hours, not to mention whatever you were trying to accomplish that run. Trying to complete the easter egg and finally had all four golden items in your inventory? Start over. Finally get a recipe you've been looking for? Lose it and try again. Yet when you log back in, there are the popups to remind you to give them more money via micros. Do they put that money toward making sure their game is in a proper state? Of course not. 

Would love to give this game a glowing review because it has so much stuff going for it, but with these sorts of issues and no compensation to the player when the bugs happen (their bug report isn't linked to your account, so they have no way of contacting or compensating you, and so i believe nobody reads them), it's just a complete feels-bad every few runs when another game-breaking bug is ran into. 

Fix your game so I can recommend it please.

game is dog vomit. came with less features than mw2019 and the same problems. missing features other titles had at launch. butchered gen shepherd as a character in the campaign. the only redeeming feat of the game is its multiplayer, but even then its even more broken and buggy than mw 2019, oh and dont even get me started on proximity based flash bangs, gotta lower the skill ceiling for the shitters. the UI makes me want to claw my eyes out of my damn skull, why did we move to horizontal when vertical was so much better? ever hear the saying "if it aint broke, dont fix it"? why they even thought to make this dogshit UI is beyond me. while they have fixed SOME of the bugs in the menu it appears at least half the bugs they fixed were only partially fixed. i shit you not if they made a direct copy of 19 and added on to it (new guns, more challenges, etc) that shit would be better than what we got. HOW THE ACTUAL HELL DO YOU NOT HAVE HARDCORE AT LAUNCH LIKE EVERY OTHER CALL OF DUTY TITLE OUT THERE??? it makes no sense to me.

on the brightside, the game lobbies remind me of the good old days back on MW2 id rather just sit in a lobby that has people talking rather than play and just listen to the funny shit that gets said, but it aint gonna last forever unfortunately, i garuntee they soy filled idiots over at activision/infinity ward are gonna crack down hard on the only thing that makes this game remotely entertaining.

Edit: the red diamond over my head in core multiplayer is fucking stupid, remove it please.

edit 2: another 307 hours in and its passable for a complete game but its still dogshit

edit 3: 791 hours in these are my final remarks:
fuck activision blizzard, fuck infinity ward, and most importantly fuck this franchise as a whole. the lazy writing and the constant inability to release an update that doesnt make the game unplayable for a week really killed it, i grinded for my camos thats all this games getting. no longer am i gonna submit to call of corperations: consume product. in the end mw2 was still trash, blackcell was just a blatant money grab because the smart players were saving their cod points and losing them out on some of that microtransaction money. im tired of battle passes, im tired of these companies abusing FOMO and more importantly im tired of seeing one of my childhood franchises turn into this blatant cashgrab instead of the passion project made by a company dedicated to their craft. im not purchasing mw3, and i probably wont purchase any cod titles in the future, and honestly they should of just released mw3 as an addon to mw2. definitely not at the price of over 80 fucking dollars. yall are fucked if you think im paying 80 fucking dollars for an expansion pack of a game that was mid as fuck. not to even mention they fact they do nothing about the blatant hackers that advertise themselves on x/twitter, youtube, etc. the only reason activision blizzard gets to continue making this slop instead of going out of buisness is because daddy microsoft wants to absorb them. this company deserves to fail at this point. i wish i could get those 791 hours back.

Changed my review to negative late in the MW2 cycle and on MW3's release didn't think it was going to change either.. but honestly the game is fun at the moment. Plenty of modes and events cycling, the daily and challenge system is a good amount of dopamine and there's not too many annoying ones. 
I like some of the newer systems like attachment challenge unlocks (e.g. complete two dailies to unlock a chosen attachment, even ones that usually require fully levelling weapons). And above all.. the game is just fun, MW2019 particularly the maps were mostly utter crap, MW2 was an improvement mostly, and MW3 using has a good mix of classic MW2 maps and newer ones added since release. The ones in the new season I like a lot! And stuff like the changed maps for events are really cool.
Overall the state of the game is an 8/10 again now (I would have considered MW2 a 6/10 shortly before MW3 came out, a mess of mismanagement).

Too many bright and vibrant colored operator skins and camos. It looks like someone threw up a rainbow on the game. Needs more regular and realistic camos and operator skins and less neon vomit. Also i cant stand the fact that every operator has to be some tier 1 edgelord or some celebrity and or other character from media. Just give us generic soldiers and let us customize every aspect with them like in COD ghosts.  Also custom gun camos, decals and emblems needs to return.

 The micro transaction system is extremely predatory and greedy as well. I think there needs to be more things that require skill or in game milestones to unlock.

 Skill  based matchmaking is awful as well because you either roll lobbies or get rolled. SBMM makes the game feel to competetive and sweaty when i just wanna get into a random lobby and just chill out. 

The moderation system is horrible to using AI to monitor in game voice chats is a terrible idea as well. The concept of  using AI to monitor VC is just extremely creepy and dystopic just because a few select individuals get offended at players on an M rated game. I can understand it being used to stop people from saying things that are flat out racist or whatever but where are you going to draw the line with it. If people get offended they can just mute the person, thats why a mute button exists.

EDIT: 
So i caved in and got MW3 just to give it a fair chance and actually play the game. Literally just a copy and  paste of MW2 from the UI, weapon unlock system, scorestreaks etc. SBMM is destroying the game for casual  players. The one thing i do like about this game is the invasion and ground war game modes. The SBMM isnt as strong feeling in it and alot of the people who play those modes are more casual fans of the series so those servers dont really feel sweaty. But outside of those two game modes MW3 is pretty terrible. If i could refund it i would.

Hello fellow gamers,

After eagerly anticipating it for some time, I finally got the chance to dive into the world of Zombies with my son. I patiently waited for a discount before purchasing the game, ensuring we could both enjoy the experience together.

As for the game itself, it has provided us with countless hours of enjoyment. The Zombie campaign (Act 1-4) injects a sense of purpose and challenge into the gameplay, with plenty of opportunities for exploration. While we encountered a few bugs that necessitated a restart in the menus (never during gameplay), overall, the experience has been fulfilling. Admittedly, the menu design might be a bit confusing for newcomers, but I appreciate the concept of having all games accessible from a single interface.

Regarding my support experience, I encountered an issue with some additional skins I purchased (Blackcell) not appearing in-game. Upon discovering that others had faced similar issues through community comments, I promptly opened a ticket with Activision. To my delight, I received a comprehensive answer and solution within a mere 2 hours.

In summary, this game offers both an enjoyable gaming experience and exceptional customer support. I highly recommend giving it a try, especially with the current 3-day free trial available. Gather some friends or family and embark on this thrilling adventure together.

Happy gaming!

I have not played the campaign yet and I have missed several cod games. Black Ops and MW3 were my last multiplayer cod purchases. When I came back I find that spawn killing is worse than ever. What is with these micro transactions?!?! The price for each one is ridiculous and they just keep adding more! Which sounds good in theory but when 99 percent of the items are useless, kinda ugly junk, it defeats the purpose of adding them. It looks like someone with ADHD designed most of the skins, emblems, and calling cards. Almost all includes rapidly flashing lights and rapidly moving waves of light and color. Some could look good if they stopped trying to treat this as a techno rave party. Give us an option to slow it all down! I do not have any issues with seizures and things like that. I just find these as ugly distractions, both of which are unwanted. You can tell all they want is us to give them more money for things that should all ready be included in the game. Or at least be reasonably priced! And also they will not allow you to buy only the one item you are interested in. They make you purchase a bundle of items I do not want and will never use thus making you pay even more for nothing. This newest update, season 2 battlepass, removed the lethal grenades from several of my loadouts!!! For no reason and without ant kind of notification. The weapon attachment system needs a lot of changes. Yes we can use more attachments now but their effects are illogical and sometimes contradictory. Not to mention why is there a number limit on the amount of attachments that you can use?!?! If you make it, use it!

This continues to be aimed at kids and just reminds me why I switched to Battlefield 3 in the past. Are they any better now? I don't know. I just realize that I probably will not purchase any more releases of this franchise. If I was not trying to play with friends I would not have purchased this one. I would rate this multiplayer game as 4 maybe 5 out of ten. When rating the price/value I would give it a one out of ten.

Great fun to play when it works, but constant crashes make the game unplayable. This is by far the most unreliable game I have ever played. I play mainly for zombies mode, but crashing / disconnecting in 1 in 3 games, which loses you all of your equipment and punishes you by making you start from scratch, is game-breaking. This is incredibly poor form for a AAA game that charges £60 entry fee + extras for the battle pass.

The game itself is so-so but the big problems are: 
A) The massive amount of cheaters. Seeing people track you through 2 walls or consistently headshot-ing you across the map with an SMG is no fun. 

B) The crossplay is just nonsense or rather giving controller players really strong aim assist is. There is no way the average player can win against a slide-canceling guy rushing around the corner with this strong of aim assist. Hilariously THEY have the ability to turn off crossplay.

C) No dedicated servers are a terrible idea when combined with skill based match making. 1 minute I am in a lobby with excellent ping. The next minute I am in a lobby with huge packet loss, huge latency, and a full clan of ranked players. 

D) No dedicated servers (again) also means their weird playlists with garbage maps like shipment. Don't get me wrong shipment can be fun but with CODs spawn system it is a real shit-show every time. I think it isn't a viable map for anything but FFA. I, however, like objective based game modes which shipment is a terrible map for. So, I would like to be able to elect not to play it. With dedicated servers that was no problem because you could see the map list. Here, this is a huge problem. If I get to a terrible map for objective I have two choices either play and hope that my team understands how to play objective and possibly suffer the consequences of it OR back out of the lobby and play the lobby lottery only to possibly end up in a lobby with terrible latency and packet loss.

• The writer loves the original Modern Warfare series and has enjoyed the reboot Modern Warfare series from a multiplayer perspective.
• The writer has put almost 1200 hours into Modern Warfare 2 2022 over the past year.
• The writer thinks Modern Warfare 3 is a massive disappointment and a bust.
• The maps are the writer's biggest complaint with the game in its current form.
• Modern Warfare 3 is recycling the maps from the original Modern Warfare 2 and bundling them up into this multiplayer.
• The writer never really liked any of the Modern Warfare 2 maps and thinks they are way too big.
• The writer believes that the great experience of Modern Warfare 2 from a gameplay mechanic standpoint made him love the multiplayer of that game despite not liking any of the maps.
• Unless there's a Russ 24/7 game mode, the writer does not see himself wanting to play much of this multiplayer.

The author feels that the maps are too big and result in players spending too much time outside of combat. The author also notes that the game is recycling maps from the original Modern Warfare 2 and remastering them, which is not appealing to the author. The author concludes that the game is a massive disappointment and labels it as such, despite the fact that the author had high expectations for it.

I blame no one but Activision for fomenting such a ridiculous multiplayer experience. There is no explanation to being aim-botted when I already sent multiple rounds through the other player's face frequently. Now I've played all the COD's since the first one. I've played all the Battle Fields. I regularly play Ready or Not. In other words, I know my way around shooters, not to mention using cover. As such, when I do die this is usually a result of not checking my corners and breaking cover and carelessly standing out in the open for too long. Given this though, there are things which don't make sense such as the above, which ultimately leaves you feeling frustrated instead of enjoying the game. Ultimately this is another example of the major studios not respecting the money we give them.

MWIII Pre Season 1 Review: 

Multiplayer: Not recommended

- MWII weapons are op and should have waited till MWIII season 1 to put them in.

- They ruined the spawns on the OG MW2 maps. Spawns are terrible and I mean fucking terrible to the point where it's annoying. Enemies spawn right behind you. You spawn right next to them and they kill you and your whole team. Stop with the whole squad spawn or whatever it is you have and just use normal spawn + spawn protection (with how shit the spawns are spawn protection is needed).

- SBMM is toned up to the point where I see 0 to little  improvement in my game-play compared to the previous cods 2019-now. Tone this shit down. 

Gunsmith, Gun-play, Movement, gear perk system are solid. This game has a good foundation and the main fixes to mp that are needed is SBMM & the spawn system that's it. 
 
Zombies: recommended
- More to do than outbreak.
- More fun than DMZ. 
L> Lots of missions and contracts that give you solid rewards.
- Chill camo grind.
- Fun solo and treats solo players well.
- Other players can be annoying and ruin your train when doing kills for camos.
-  Difficulty zones is awesome.

Please add round base. I've been wanting a MW zombies for years and this is really good but adding round base would be dope. Add back the outbreak contract that would put you in a 2 story building and you fight hordes of enemies. I'm impressed with how good zombies is and it's better than I thought it would've been. Keep up the good work on MWZ and expand on it.

MWII Final Season Review: Mixed

I've been on and off this game from launch all the way until mid-season 3. After that, I played the game on a daily basis, except for mid-season 5, when my PC broke. I put 400+ hours into this game. I did Orion, Ghoulie, and 90% of the calling cards for MWII MP. I beat campaign and spec ops. This game is by far the worst modern warfare game, but it is a mid-cod game and is better than BO4 and Vanguard, two of the worst cods, in my opinion. Besides the ♥♥♥♥ launch, like I said, this game is mid. Here are my pros and cons.

Cons:
- Perk system: 2/4 of them are based on time, which was stupid; no one asked for this.

- The weapon level system was dumb as ♥♥♥♥; I don't want to level up my shotgun for a red dot.
on my AK. This feature is annoying at first, but once you level up a category, family, and/or all weapons it's fine

- SBMM

- Servers: from seasons 4–5, this game would crash my whole system basically whenever I would get any sort of latency or connection issue and was extremely annoying.
- Optimization: again, from seasons 4–5, this game ran like ♥♥♥♥. I went from playing at all high settings 90-100fps to putting everything to all low except for textures to get the same fps. This game looks worse than 2019, and in that game, I get better performance at max than this ♥♥♥♥.

- Spawn system: Whoever added squad spawn is a moron. If I'm playing domination and I cap A and B I own those areas, and only me and my team should spawn at A and B; enemies shouldn't spawn next to me. If I'm in a gunfight with the enemy teammate, the ♥♥♥♥ should spawn at C, not next to me, not at A or B.

- Adding the Lachman shroud and ISO 9mm was a lazy addition; they could've been attachments for the ISO 45 and Lachman Sub, not a new gun.

- Lack of 2x xp weekends and doing a 24-hour one was dumb as ♥♥♥♥.

Pros:
- Ranked
- Weapon tuning
- Maps
- Consistent events and content
- Gunplay
- Movement after the update it got in season 4 or 5
- The number of weapons and operators

There's a rampant issue with shadow bans when people mass report you if you're good. You'll get kicked off your games and be put on cheater lobbies until your account is reviewed. For those wondering, that's what the CASERMA - GOODFELLOW error means.

I was first banned on Saturday 17th, during the 2XP event. Unbanned on the 19th, banned again after playing for an hour when I got mass reported by two teams in two games in a row. Back to cheater lobbies now. Literally can't play and enjoy the game I paid for.

Of course, abusing the report system and screaming at the mic of how you should die for "using hacks" is completely fine and unpunished. But beware if you're even remotely good or someone just doesn't like you.

UPDATE 1: On December 23rd, the second shadow ban was lifted.
UPDATE 2: On December 29th, I was shadow banned ONCE AGAIN after getting a nuke. Good game!
UPDATE 3: On January 1st, I'm unbanned from my third shadow ban. Time to speedrun the fourth!
UPDATE 4: On January 2nd, I'm banned with my fourth ban. Good run boys.
UPDATE 5: On January 5th, I'm unbanned from my fourth ban. Time to get that fifth!
UPDATE 6: On April 7th, I'm banned with my fifth ban. And here I thought I got whitelisted!

The skill based match making in this game makes no fucking sense. I played this COD religiously for the first 3 months of its release for camo grinding (as I do with every COD). This got me to around level 170 or whatever the max was at the time. I then decided I would took a break after getting diamond camo on everything before going for dark matter. (The camo and weapon unlock in this game is an entire god awful system that deserves its own review). Upon returning to the game a full year later I decided to hop into a game with my buddy after work for a chill music and COD session only to be greated with the worst skill based matchmaking I have ever seen. With full honesty every single player except for maybe one or two on the enemy team every single game would be between the levels of 600-900. Obviously me and my friend were getting our shit kicked in every single game usually having k/d of 40/40-60+. Every single game there would be at least two level 600+ running around with a shotgun and one-shotting everyone across the map. I would then proceed to hear the screaming of multiple 12-16 year olds absolutely cracked out on monster at the end of every single match telling me I'm dog shit because I have a job and can't invest 10+ hours a day on this video game to keep up with the sub-human evolution that these parent-less children are going through. 
Moral of the story if you do a line of coke then you might be able to compete with the absolute mongoloid community of 14 year olds that snort a line of g-fuel and down a monster before loading into their 400th consecutive game without providing anything meaningful to society.

EDIT: Took a big break from the game and decided to hop on the new one (MW3) and see if anything changed. It's actually even worse now. I haven't been in a single lobby where the entire team wasn't max level, and you'd think that maybe that would mean they are really good and moving around alot right? NOPE. Every single game is filled with people just camping in a corner. EVERY SINGLE MATCH. Not to mention the fact that they CAN'T DESIGN ANY NEW MAPS FOR SHIT. "Let's make a map that is completely centralized around a very small portion and then make all the spawns way out the fuck in the middle of nowhere so after you die to a guy in a corner once getting to where the action is, THEN YOU HAVE TO RUN BACK THERE FOR LIKE 30 SECONDS ONLY TO DIE TO ANOTHER GUY CAMPING A DIFFERENT CORNER. Or, WELL MAKE A MAP THAT'S SO SMALL THAT WITHIN LITERAL MILI-SECONDS OF YOU SPAWNING YOU DIE AGAIN. 
The skill based match making still feels like the biggest piece of dogshit I've ever experienced. I'm trying to play casual team deathmatch with a beer after work and it feels like I'm fighting for my fucking life. The part that gets on my nerves is being the lowest level in the lobby by over 100 or 200 ranks. Like what the fuck. And these people have put that much time into this game and still don't have interstellar (the dark matter/damascus camo of this game). Like how the fuck are you level 290 you havent completed the challenges for the guns when I'M LEVEL 70, I PLAY CASUALLY, AND I HAVE IT. 

Moral of the story: they took all the worst parts of MW2 and stitched them together with black magic and sorcery to create something that should have never even been released in hell. Every minute of playing this game I can literally feel my soul dying and all happiness leaving my body for the rest of the day. If you do intend on buying and playing this game, make sure your friends get it too and only run Search and Destroy sessions with the boys. The rest of multiplayer is dogshit, zombies is dogshit and it should be illegal to even call it call of duty zombies, and Warzone 2 is almost as bad of a second coming as CSGO 2. The reason why COD is dying is because the studios are money sucking vampires that drain the life force out of everyone who has the misfortune of playing this game,

honest opinion below TLDR: I NEED TO BE DRUNK OR ON DRUGS SO I CAN ENJOY THIS STEAMING PILE OF SHIT. NO ONE WANTS TO BUY THIS $70 STINKER TO TRY IT OUT OR BOTHER WITH IT TO PLAY IT,

Edit:
With the release of Modern Warfare 3, I will not be purchasing another Call of Duty game for a long time. I really did like MW2, but now that all future games have been merged (there goes your innovation, by the way) I'm forced to download a 40 gigabyte update for a game I don't own. 

I also need to wait five minutes to load into MW2 because there's no option to launch directly into it (tried clicking the EXE direct from its folder, but no luck), so I need to launch "Call of Duty®" (takes a while already), get an "Update requires restart" message, reboot the whole thing, and launch MW2.

All that because I don't want to pay $90 for the same, repackaged game that I bought in 2022. These people are even SAVING QUALITY OF LIFE CHANGES, such as selecting maps, for new games only to further entice people into switching to MW3.

Not only that, they actually, somehow, MERGED THE REVIEWS for Modern Warfare 3 in with MW2's reviews, (since it's all "Call of Duty®" now, right?), giving the new store page an overall "Mixed" score, as opposed to the true "Overwhelmingly negative" score for MW3. I don't think that's ever been done on steam before.

I'm not the biggest CoD fan, MW2 was the first one I really stuck to since Black Ops, but it feels like the whole "Call of Duty®" thing has become so anti-consumer that nobody should buy their games anymore.
Why PAY $90 for a game with a shelf life of a year, that still has the terrible monetization practices of mobile games, and crossovers that dilute the whole game's identity. No, Nikki Minaj, Alucard and Messi do not belong in Call of Duty (but smoking 21 Savage is fun).

[b]The Call of Duty "Yearly assembly line" must be, finally, stopped. Make a game and stick to it.[/b] 

[b] No more battle passes, no more DLC gun skins, no more crossovers, no more yearly CoD, and for the love of god, stop recycling the names of past Call of Duty games.[/b] 
Modern Warfare 2 came out in 2009, and the "Modern" Modern Warfare 3 game is actually Modern Warfare 6.

Recycling game names wasn't cool when DOOM did it, wasn't cool when Saints Row did it, wasn't cool when you did it for MW4 (MW2019), and would you look at that, the first Mortal Kombat game just got released (Mortal Kombat 1).

Thanks for reading. Vote with your wallet.

*MWII review preserved for prosperity; this recommendation is strictly for MWIII*

Has some of the now-traditional CoD jank to it still, but in terms of overall entertainment CoD MWIII's multiplayer is a lot more fun than MWII's. Just don't bother with the campaign, by all reports it's absolute trash.

Final update: Seeing as the game still has some glaring issues (esp with spawns), and Activision's going the P2W route with DMZ, I'm bumping this back down to Not-Recommended. Fuck this game, and fuck everyone who buys the P2W DMZ-related bundles.

Update: After spending a decent amount of extra time on MWII, I can now say that it's gotten to the point where I can recommend buying it, just not for $70. Wait for a decent (by Activision standards, at least) sale first, then go for it.

As much as I enjoyed MWII, and as much as I want to recommend it, at its current state I am unable to do so. Game has a level of unpolish that would make an Early Access release blush (fair number of bugs, and IW/Activision doesn't seem to have any real sense of urgency in fixing them; safe to say the whole game should have been labeled as a Beta, not just DMZ/Warzone), the maps are of inconsistent quality (and instead of fixing them, they add SHIPMENT, the worst map in the CoD franchise by a large margin; that is not up to debate) and, most importantly and the biggest reason I'm giving this a thumbs down, the "Skill-Based" Matchmaking system is at least 10x as aggressive as it was in MW(2019), and just as sadistic in making sure you don't have a fun time on a consistent basis.

Will give another spin when Season 2 hits and will update the review if an update is warranted. At its current state though, spend your money on something else.

[h1] Call of Duty® [/h1]
[h2] Introduction: [/h2]
It  is a popular first-person shooter franchise that has been around since 2003. The series covers various historical and fictional conflicts, from World War II to the modern day. In this review, I will focus on the following aspects of the game: graphics, combat, players, game support and conclusion.

[h2] Graphics: [/h2]
The game features stunning graphics, realistic sound effects, and smooth gameplay that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The graphics are rich and detailed, with realistic lighting, shadows, and textures. The sound effects are loud and clear, with realistic gunfire, explosions, and voices.

[h2] Combat: [/h2]
The combat is fast-paced and dynamic, with different weapons, perks, and killstreaks to choose from. The weapons range from assault rifles, shotguns, and sniper rifles, to rocket launchers, grenades, and knives. The perks give you different abilities, such as faster reloading, increased health, and stealth. The killstreaks reward you for killing enemies in a row, such as calling in a UAV, a helicopter, or a missile strike.

[h2] Campaign: [/h2]
The campaign mode follows a gripping story of a global conflict, with different characters, locations, and objectives.

[h2] Multiplayer: [/h2]
The multiplayer mode allows you to compete with other players online, with different modes, such as team deathmatch, domination, and search and destroy. The co-op mode allows you to team up with other players online or offline, with different missions, such as survival, spec ops, and chaos.

The game also introduces RICOCHET: Anti-Cheat, a new system that aims to prevent, detect, and ban cheaters from the online matches. However, despite these efforts, some players have reported encountering hackers who use various tools to gain an unfair advantage over others. In this review, I will discuss the multiplayer hacking problem in MWIII and how it affects the gameplay experience.

Multiplayer hacking is not a new issue in the Call of Duty series, as previous titles such as Modern Warfare II and Warzone have also suffered from cheaters who use aimbots, wall hacks, speed hacks, and other exploits. These cheats allow hackers to see through walls, aim automatically, move faster, and perform other actions that give them an edge over legitimate players. Some hackers even use tools to modify their stats, unlock all weapons and perks, and create custom lobbies with altered rules. These hacks ruin the balance and fun of the game for everyone else, as they make it impossible to compete or enjoy the match.

According to the developers, RICOCHET: Anti-Cheat is designed to combat cheating in MWIII by using a combination of client and server-side systems that evolve and grow over time. The system also uses machine learning to examine client and server data, issue account challenges, and collect and collate problem accounts for action. The system does not issue bans automatically, but rather alerts the #TeamRICOCHET team to review the suspicious behavior and take appropriate measures. The system also uses game code obfuscation and encryption to prevent hackers from reverse-engineering the game files.

However, despite these measures, some hackers have managed to bypass RICOCHET: Anti-Cheat and continue to cheat in MWIII. Some of them use private or paid hacks that are updated frequently to evade detection. Others use VPNs or spoof their IP addresses to avoid bans or create new accounts. Some hackers even claim that they cheat as a form of protest against the developers or publishers for various reasons, such as microtransactions, bugs, or lack of content. These hackers show no remorse or respect for other players or the game itself.

The multiplayer hacking problem in MWIII is a serious issue that affects the quality and longevity of the game. It discourages players from playing online or investing in the game's progression system. It also damages the reputation and credibility of the developers and publishers who claim to have a robust anti-cheat system. It is unclear how effective RICOCHET: Anti-Cheat will be in the long run, or whether it will be able to catch up with the evolving hacking methods. Until then, players who want to enjoy MWIII online will have to hope that they do not encounter any hackers in their matches.

[h2] Game Support: [/h2]
The game support is responsive and helpful, with a dedicated customer service to address any issues or feedback.

[table]
    [tr]
[th][h1][b] Conclusion: [/b][/h1]
Call of Duty MWIII is a great game that delivers an exciting and engaging experience of modern warfare. It is a game that will appeal to fans of the genre and newcomers alike. It is a game that deserves a high rating and a strong recommendation.[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]

I bought this game because of friends and family talked me into it. I wasn't really expecting a whole lot due to the videos I seen on YouTube and the really bad reviews. Now I don't play Multiplayer or Ranked. It is real sweaty for no reason. I only play Zombies. What I can say is Zombies is fun for me. It's challenging even though it's Warzone with zombies. The only thing I dislike about zombies is the stash system. I feel like you need more stash space rather doing the tombstone glitch. I feel like if you increase it to 30-40 you really shouldn't have a hard time debating on what to keep. Now would I pay full price for this game, absolutely not. I can care less about Ranked, Multiplayer, Warzone, and the Campaign. Buying this game for Zombies is silly in itself. In other words, I do have fun and it makes the time pass. Spend your money on how you want to spend it. The skins and battlepass are ok and cool but not worth it in my opinion. Once again, spend your money on what you want. Of course server issues do arise, I personally think developers need to make sure the servers are maintained more thoroughly and monitored, because the crashes were really brutal, knowing I had to start from scratch over and over again. Wrapping up, it's an ok game. Zombies, you really have to grind for what you have to accomplish. Multiplayer, Ranked, Warzone, and Campaign are just meh. Spend your money at your own risk. Hope this helps for some people!

After not playing a CoD game since BO2, I remember why I stopped playing. It's just kinda boring, especially with the modern design. The guns no longer have identities, there's 10 million attachments that seem to all add up to doing virtually nothing, and I don't really have a sense of progression since the industry moved to these stupid battlepass chaos maps and tokens rather than clear unlock systems. I played pretty regularly for about a week until the novelty of being a shark never able to stop wore off. The big map are very much like Battlefield and I find those fun, but there's only like 3 so I get extremely bored of them after playing all day. Then I usually don't boot this up for a week+ after burning myself out like that. 

It's basically just a big money pit too, if you want to be actually doing anything interesting like changing your visuals, etc. I don't really get why ppl would want to pay upwards of $20 just to look weird in an otherwise 'serious' military shooter but whatever. I guess if you like Fortnite for some reason as an adult, buy this? I might be legitimately playing right now and flipping this to a recc if only they'd double or quadruple the fun 50v50 maps. But running around the same six little boxes like a hamster on a wheel  with no team play or real player interaction at all for 8 hours just isn't particularly entertaining to me in my 30s anymore. Hardcore playlist is fun for awhile but the maps just aren't designed for it like in CS. If they had 24/7 access to gungames I'd also play this a lot more.

Oh and they completely destroyed Zombies. Zero fun to be had there. Feels like the gameplay of a Steam asset flip mixed with the graphics of a high quality steam asset flip.

MW3 Review:

When this game first released, I beat the campaign and found myself disappointed. Tried playing MP for two hours, had the sweatiest lobbies I've ever encountered, then refunded my Vault Edition purchase. (Still got a refund despite being over two hours.) A few months went by then they did the free trial weekend. IDK what happened but it felt completely different. I have having the time of my life that weekend and ended up buying the standard edition on sale for $49. Let me give a quick review of everything:

Campaign: If you are buying for campaign, you'll be super disappointed. 2/3 of the missions are these "open world" missions with recycled areas of Verdansk which you can complete in less than 5 mins if you just go straight for the objective. The story is also lacking a ton, a huge step down from MW2. The ending leaves in a state of "Wait, that's it??". The campaign is the worst part of this game and very forgettable do not buy for the story. I give it a 3/10.

Multiplayer is the best part here. All the changes and new features they've added make it feel so good. The movement is like a mid point between MW19 and MW2, and the TTK is slower. Everything flows so much better. The MP consists of remakes of all the MW2 (2009) maps (clearly meant as a DLC to MW2 2022 originally) and they play alright. They also ported over some of the MW2 2022 maps, and all the content you had in MW2 2022 carries over to MW3, something I hope becomes standard for the series going forward. The worst part is the new armory unlock system, requiring you complete daily challenges to unlock various weapons, gadgets, attachments, etc. Overall, I'd give it a 7/10 and may actually say its the most fun multiplayer of the recent CoDs.

Modern Warfare Zombies is clearly just a retool of DMZ from MW2, whoever, I think it offers a unique take on zombies. Just like DMZ, you can do a variety of objectives as you run around the now Warzone map, earning points to buy perks and pack your guns, so you can move to the tier 2 and tier 3 areas for harder enemies but better loot. You can play with a squad or turn off fill to go in solo, and you can run into other squads on the map that can assist you and possible join you. When you exfil, you keep the gear you picked up as you played and can sometimes find crafting recipes to make stuff like perks before you even jump into the map. Overall, MWZ is best described as a crossover between MW2's DMZ and BOCW's Outbreak. I give it a 7/10. I think its worth trying if you like DMZ or zombies.

My final verdict for the game in total would be a 6/10. It can be fun, but it has a lot of recycled content since it was a DLC that Sledgehammer was unfortunately forced to turn into a full game with very little time. I will recommend only if the game is on sale and only if you are interested in MWZ or Multiplayer. Campaign enjoyers can ignore this game altogether.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MW2 Review:

This game fell off so hard after launch. After I finished the season one pass, which I only finished because I started with it 50% unlocked, I pretty much did not touch it again. 

I will sing some praises for MW2. The campaign was a lot of fun, probably the best part of the game. The characters are likable and it kept me wanting to play until it was finished because I was so invested in it. Ghost is amazing and we need more of him. Additionally, I appreciate Activision implementing AI voice recognition to finally crack down on the racists and bigots that plague this game. I end up just turning of voice chat completely so I don't have to here slurs every game.   

The major flaws in the multiplayer showed up once the honeymoon phase of this game ended. SBMM is back and at its worst here. You have one, fun, well-balanced and enjoyable match? Get ready for five matches of getting pounded into the group by the sweatiest players you can imagine. It honestly makes it feel like a chore to play the game. The TTK is so high here too. You get no reaction time. Pushing is punished so hard. I feel like I get shut down all the time because I die so fast before I can even understand what is happening or before I even get the opportunity to pull the trigger. 

The game has so much potential to be amazing. The community gives feedback to IW all the time, but its like talking to a brick wall. However, turns out they did listen, but refused to change anything so they can put all the changes into MW3 and claim they listened so the sheep buy the new game. You want a fun game? Too bad, buy one of our new store bundles. 

This is all so disappointed. I got excited for a CoD game for the first time ever when MW19 was announced. Now all that hype is gone. I will not be buying a full price CoD game for the foreseeable future. I cannot recommend MW2 and I encourage others to speak with their wallets.

No other game company or game for that matter, has been so consistent and successful at failing to give players even remotely what they want. With that being said however, I will be purchasing the next call of duty so that Activision will return my family to me. Thank you for coming to my TED talk

The sbmm in this game is insane. Every single game the lobby you are in is cleared out and you are placed in a new one that updates based off how you did last game.  Gone are the days of making lobby friends, having some competitive games where you win some lose some with the same group. The game just trys to keep you at 1.0KD. 

Example: I start the day rusty playing core TD. Every one just runs around and dies. No one has a strat or thought into whats going on. About 5 games in and im in lobbies of CORE td where both of our teams are holding corners and everyone is running meta guns. Super sweaty play every game. Most of the TD games no side hits the win kill limit, one side will win on time alone. Its wild... 

In all this just isnt fun. I feel like im just playing with bots that adjust to how im doing. It never feels like I make progress skill wise since the lobbies change every 10 mins. Last cod ill buy.

Played only for the campaign.  The campaign had all these additional mission-types, like guiding your player via 3rd person view, which I didn't like.  Also a crafting system was introduced for some missions, which was forced in some cases.
In the first mission with crafting I just ignored the items and used my shotgun to blast through the dozen+ enemies.

Also was a hassle to sit through all the gameplay updates that were mostly for multiplayer.  Also a pain to start up each game, having to step thru all the multiplayer menus.

They should have split off the single-player campaign to make it a stand-alone title, and just stuck to the traditional campaign elements- a wild story, interesting characters and challenging missions and equipment. 

Last COD I'll buy for a while until they put better attention to the single-player campaign experience.

I have reviewed your terms and guidelines thoroughly and can confidently state that I have not violated any policies intentionally. However, I understand the importance of maintaining a secure gaming environment and acknowledge the seriousness of any breach.

To resolve this matter promptly and fairly, I plan to file a formal complaint with the State Attorney General's office. I believe this step is necessary to ensure a transparent and unbiased review of my account status. I am hopeful that this escalation will encourage a swift and thorough investigation on your part.

I kindly request an immediate review of my account and a reconsideration of the ban. I am more than willing to cooperate fully with your team and provide any necessary information to facilitate a quick resolution. Additionally, I will keep the State Attorney General's office updated on the progress of this matter.

I understand that Activision values its players and strives to provide a positive gaming experience. I trust that, with your assistance, we can swiftly resolve this issue and restore my account to good standing.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to a prompt and fair resolution.

The Impact of September 11, 2001, on Global Politics, Security, and Society

Introduction:

The events of September 11, 2001, commonly referred to as 9/11, marked a pivotal moment in contemporary history, reshaping global politics, security dynamics, and societal perceptions. The coordinated terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center towers in New York City and the Pentagon in Washington, D.C., orchestrated by the extremist group al-Qaeda, had far-reaching consequences that reverberated across the world. This essay explores the multifaceted impact of 9/11 on international relations, security policies, and the socio-cultural landscape.

Historical Context:

To comprehend the significance of 9/11, it is essential to consider the historical context leading up to the attacks. Al-Qaeda, led by Osama bin Laden, had declared jihad against the United States and its allies. The group operated from Afghanistan, which was under the Taliban regime at the time. The attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon were meticulously planned acts of terrorism that aimed to provoke a global response and advance the extremist ideology of radical Islamism.

Global Political Landscape:

The aftermath of 9/11 witnessed a seismic shift in the global political landscape. The United States, under President George W. Bush, declared a "War on Terror" and initiated military interventions in Afghanistan and later Iraq, citing the need to eliminate terrorist threats and prevent the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The invasions had profound geopolitical consequences, reshaping alliances and straining international relations.

The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) invoked Article 5 for the first time in its history, considering the attacks on the United States as an attack against all its members. This collective defense clause underscored the gravity of the situation and led to increased cooperation among NATO allies in addressing the evolving threat of global terrorism.

Security Policies and Counterterrorism Measures:

The events of 9/11 prompted a reassessment of national security policies and the implementation of unprecedented counterterrorism measures. The USA PATRIOT Act, passed shortly after the attacks, granted law enforcement agencies expanded surveillance powers, increased intelligence-sharing capabilities, and facilitated the tracking and apprehension of suspected terrorists.

Internationally, efforts to combat terrorism intensified with enhanced cooperation among intelligence agencies, law enforcement bodies, and security forces. The creation of the Department of Homeland Security in the United States exemplified a comprehensive approach to safeguarding the nation against future terrorist threats.

Airport security protocols underwent a significant overhaul, with the introduction of rigorous screening procedures and advanced technologies to detect potential threats. The emphasis on intelligence gathering and information sharing became paramount in preventing terrorist activities and disrupting extremist networks.

Societal Impact and Cultural Shifts:

The impact of 9/11 extended beyond the realms of politics and security, permeating societal attitudes and cultural perceptions. The attacks generated a heightened sense of vulnerability, leading to increased public awareness and concern regarding personal safety and national security. The trauma inflicted by the visual and emotional impact of the attacks persisted in the collective memory of the American people and the global community.

Islamophobia emerged as a disturbing consequence of the attacks, with individuals of Muslim faith facing discrimination, prejudice, and racial profiling. This highlighted the importance of fostering cultural understanding, religious tolerance, and combating stereotypes to promote a more inclusive and harmonious society.

Conclusion:

The events of September 11, 2001, left an indelible mark on the world, reshaping the geopolitical landscape, transforming security policies, and influencing societal attitudes. The post-9/11 era ushered in a new paradigm characterized by heightened vigilance, increased cooperation in the fight against terrorism, and a reevaluation of international relations. As we reflect on the impact of 9/11, it is imperative to recognize the need for ongoing efforts to address the root causes of extremism, promote global cooperation, and foster a world that values peace, tolerance, and understanding.

As i just finished the campaign i feel that i can leave a review now.

Campaign:
The campaign was good, and was fun. Missions were varied and presented different challenges from each other. The stealth missions and almost puzzle like mission of guiding Ghost were probably my favorites. Its hard to pass up a good old fashion gunship raining fire down though. There were some glitches with lighting in a couple but a reset of shaders fixed that pretty quick, and i think i crashed once in the play through. Overall enjoyed it, and would recommend. More power to you if you play above hardened.

Multiplayer:
Its CoD. I like the maps and the gunplay. The community is still the community. Lots of hate for camping if you want to play sniper in the large war modes. The servers do seem to have some issues, had several friends drop connection randomly in the middle of the game. I think i have had two crashes in multiplayer so far.

Overall:
Its good, i think the price tag is probably a little high but it's still fun and a good way to blow off steam.

EDIT:
Game is a hot mess, launcher is a hot mess, devs are hot mess. There are better games to spend your time on

I want to say I love this game because there are some really great elements. But there are some god awful broken elements that keep me from doing so. Sadly I spent so much money on this game. Two copies and and lots of skins but after 153 hours its busted. I am so sick of being kicked from the game only to lose things I worked hard for. 3 times I beat the girl on the tower and was booted from the game while getting a gun that only drops from there. When you leave you lose everything you have. I dont play fortnite for a reason and well MW 3  recreated that experience. They are so worried about people duplicating items and glitching the game that you almost need to glitch the game to balance the game out to be fair. Honestly spending hundreds of hours to get the right stuff in zombies to be able to play the higher level content is a waste of time because by that time you are sick of the game. Seriously after all these years you think this stuff would be worked out. And while they have learned to add more content and make the game have more depth they are slapping it together and not really putting thought into it. Cheating has wrecked all MP games now days. Its either unfair and you die all the time or the devs make it so you get screwed left and right trying to play the game. Either way this game has booted me out and stolen my stuff for the last time. If its not fixed in season 2 I wont be buying another COD game. And I have been playing since the original XBOX I keep quitting every year and someone pulls me back in. But seriously I am at the end of the rope with these developers. Figure it out already. This is not your first game and on top of that its a reskin year over year for the MP so working on things like story and zombies should not be that difficult to get right. The ideas are there now just make them work. If you lose connection because of your server let the player keep there stuff, other games do. And if they are duplicating it SO WHAT. You can only stash so much anyway its not like its going to break the game. And hell I have seen more players work together and help one another in glitches than I have ever seen in games like Destiny and such so stop worrying about it. And worry about making it stable first and foremost. My god I cant even believe this is what were talking about on COD. Yes I agree these should be reviews and not a place to express gripes but gripes are the game in this case. There isnt anything to talk about unless the game runs and lets you play . So figure that out and I will review the game.

2. Cosmetics
Like skins or weapon add-ons. Look, if you spend a lot of money on cosmetics, that's fine. What I don't like is P2W and COD/MW SERIES is not P2W

Steam comments have always been super bad/critical. However, I think the reason behind this is the huge amount of people on steam. The more people you have the more bad ones you get. Lets say you have a 1/5 chance to get a bad person on your platform. If you think about the amount of people who use steam, it becomes obvious why there are so many negative reviews on fine games.

In my opinion yes COD/MW SERIES are all good games. Good graphics, good design, not (in my opinion) P2W.

This is probably my longest, most critical, and most controversial review I've ever made. But remember people can have opinions you don't like, and that's just life.

Review is marked as not recommended because CoDHQ is preventing players from accurately determining player counts across current CoD titles. CoDHQ shows player counts for MWII, MWIII, and Warzone 2.0, which makes it impossible to determine which game has the most players. This allows Activision to make wild claims about MWIII's popularity and player count that no one outside the company can verify.

Additionally, CoDHQ is used as a launcher for all three games. This means that even if you only own MWII, you will be required to download and install MWIII even if you do not own or play it. If you want to play MWII, the game will launch MWIII first and you will have to manually select MWII. This will close and relaunch the game every time you switch titles. It is by no means a smooth transition.
