Since they have hijacked the old game client to become the COD HQ, I've moved my review for MW2022 over to the new store page for that.

The appeal of MW3/2023 remains much the same as the last entry. I imagine most that enjoyed MW2019, MW2022 titles will enjoy this one, particularly with the carry forward mechanic from the last title.

While I'm typically critical of the yearly release schedule, the carry forward mechanic, allowing me to continue to use all the guns, attachments, and camos (not to mention emblems and calling cards) that I spent all that time unlocking and building loadouts for I can still use in the new game.  And with the addition of the zombies mode, there's a whole new array of camos to get with the MW2022 weapons.

On one hand, I feel like I get to enjoy all the old content on all the new maps, sometimes even old maps that they've either ported to the game fully or made available in a limited time playlist. On the other hand, it still gives me very little reason to go back to playing MW2022 unless I want to play DMZ or am feeling particularly nostalgic for the maps which hasn't happened yet.

I know for whatever reason its a big meme for people to say that COD is the same game every year, and I can get why people who aren't into this kind of style shooter would have that perception, so what does this game bring to the table that MW2022 and previous titles didn't have?

The gunsmith has been further polished, with detailed actual stats for all the attachments and how they affect the performance of the gun. No longer do we have to rely on outside sources to get us that information, or use the tuning with vague sliders. While I liked the tuning feature, I'm more than happy with things as they are now. Given all the attachments possible now, there's little need for fine tuning since swapping attachments generally does the trick.

Gunplay is fairly similar to the last title, in the best ways, but there's a bit longer time-to-kill, which slows down the pace of fights slightly, long enough that accuracy, recoil control, and maintaining a good track of your target are a much bigger deal, versus the last game which was more heavily reliant on reaction time. That being said, compared to most shooters out there the TTK is still pretty quick, so reaction time is still a big deal.

While Coop, Raids, and DMZ didn't make it into the new COD, there's now the new MW Zombies mode, which is a very welcome and fun addition. It pulls the best of previous COD zombie modes with the progression and extraction-shooter gameplay of DMZ. While other players are present now, there is no PvP in this mode which is a welcome change since late in MW2022's lifespan DMZ became increasingly subject to PvP interrupting any chance of progression, which was rather frustrating.  Zombies is a fairly chill horde shooter, giving the player a lot of freedom to choose how much challenge they want, with different tiers of difficulty on the map in the form of "threat levels."

The map rotation brings back a lot of old favorites from previous COD titles, and plenty of new ones as well. Honestly this current rotation feels like the strongest COD has been in a long time. At least in the 6v6 format. 

As it reaches the end of the first season, there is still not a lot of variety for Ground War and Invasion. War mode currently only has one map with another on the way in Season 2. Hopefully those get more fleshed out in the coming seasons, but currently they are a bit underwhelming compared to what they were in previous titles.

I have not played Warzone terribly much so I can't speak to much to the quality of that, since I haven't been terribly interested in the Battle Royale format since the first Warzone in MW2019.

The single-player campaign starts strong enough, but its clear the devs were under quite a time-crunch putting this together in a single year when they weren't originally planning to do a sequel to MW2022's story.  It is a far cry from the scope and climactic campaigns of the original COD4MW and CODMW2&3 games.  The story just seems underdeveloped here, and there are none of the really big "wow" moments the franchise was originally known for. Out of the campaigns thus far since the reboot, this one was the weakest by far. That being said, I still enjoyed it for how little of it there was, just found the conclusion rather... Underwhelming.

As for the rest, my opinion on the state of the game is much the same as it was for MW2022. Despite how much the community likes to complain, and how much the gaming community at large likes to clown on COD games, it remains one of the best fast-paced twitchy shooters on the market in my honest opinion. I am pleasantly surprised to see the game being just as good not better than MW2022, despite the dev being the same as Vanguard, which I was not a huge fan of, nor Black Ops: Cold War.

Again it's not without its flaws, and I feel like they could have a bit more time between titles to give each title a bit more room to breathe and exist before the next, but on the whole I've had a very positive experience and look forward to the coming seasons.

A must install if you're looking for a competitive online shooter. MP is really solid, with the maps from older CoD's, and not too long ago ranked play was finally introduced. Zombies is unlike any other CoD title, with it taking inspiration from DMZ, another mode from MWII, with it's design of exploring a giant map. Being able to up the difficulty with time while you go deeper through the map, and using contract type missions you can find throughout the map, as well as getting better resources/upgrades. I haven't gotten that deep into the campaign yet, but so far it has been a nice experience and has got me hooked at to what happens next. The weapon system has gotten better with armory unlocks and attachment unlocks being a lot more understandable. Movement has definitely been improved with ability to slide cancel and such, as well as a new mechanic called "tac-stance" which is basically like switching between a variable scope, but instead ypu flip your weapon sideways to sort of mix hipfire and aiming. overall there are lots of changes that improves the franchise, and I'd hope that they can keep that going. another important mention, you will definitely need a pretty good pc to run a game like this to the point where you can enjoy the look and feel of the game. other than that its a really good game that i think most people should give a try.

On January 11th, I was wrongfully banned from Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III. After going through Activision Support, I was told that I was banned for "unauthorized software and game data manipulation." As you can see by my profile history, it is the only game ban I've ever had in my twelve years on Steam. Activision refuses to perform a proper investigation into my account to find that I was unjustly flagged by their anti cheat.

Contacting Activision Support about any problems listed above result in little to no communication, it is usually an automatic response with no chance to get an additional word in as they close your ticket.

MW3 review edit - 

Pro's:

Great maps
Great mechanics
Excellent performance (including flawless launch servers)
Addictive and fun (everything you expect form Call of Duty MP)
Great graphics (Not ground breaking but very solid)

Cons:

Weapon balancing (SMG's are pointless amongst other gripes). Metas surfaced very quickly.
SBMM is a dirge on gaming but it is what it is. Its savage. Team mates don't play objective etc. Opponents are gods whilst team mates are completely oblivious etc, continuously. 
No prestige system between season releases feels a bit rubbish. Bring back the old prestige system!
Kill streaks have lost their oomph. Hard to get and not half as impactful as they once were.
Price - £70 is a bit too steep for what was ultimately originally intended as DLC. Its great, but is it £70 worth of content? I doubt it. Then again, you either pay it or you are left behind.

WARZONE - Its dreadful. Boring, unbalanced, frantic, mindless, a complete tedious experience. I don't bother with it at all.

Conclusion:

Brilliant addition to COD. Its addictive, enjoyable, frustrating and just....COD.
SBMM and spam report shadow bans, Good system!!!!

So, I really don't know how to write this review without having an absolute disdain for Activision and coll of duty influencing an unbiased take and... well here it goes. The fact that they don't do anything to improve or add to the genre. If you want to play it then play it, just don't expect anything new or game changing.

Summary:

Added this in case you don't want to read more below. Game sucks and only wants money in an unethical way. I would recommend other games, but they too are stuck under shitty publishers. Here are a few choices Battlefield 2042 (been fixed since release), Titan fall 2 (arguably a much better game with giant robots), Battle bit (OG devs from battlefield that created it). This is my own opinion, make your own decisions. Also, to save you some time... I will not play or given them anymore of my money.

Side note:

Why the f*ck have they not incorporated destructible environments. Hell even the game "The Finals" has incorporated it and well. 

Warzone:

Ironically Fortnite, Apex Legends and PUBG did it better. Sure the guns are cool, but other people did it first.

Multiplayer:

Deliberately releasing skins that are harder to spot in shaded areas. Its just as bad as when they add new guns to the battle pass that are broken as f*ck and don't balance the issue till 4+ months later. Then that very update will break the game with endless amounts of packet issues. Updates that degrade image fidelity and dropped frames. At this point I thought that this was a triple A title then why the f*ck does this feel like a shitty Indy development team that doesn't care about their product.

I think at this point a large chunk of us are like battered spouses at this point not acknowledging the fact that this won't change. So I'm going to stop playing and giving them my money.

Do you want every single match you play to be as sweaty as a CDL game? Do you want every single player you come up against to use meta builds whilst they move across the map like a frog on meth? Do you want to play games that are shameless cash grabs from the developers? If the answer to these are yes, congrats. You've found your new favourite game. Listen, I am well aware I have a good chunk of hours into this (mostly MW2) but I really want to enjoy COD, I just can't. The game has been unequivocally ruined by SBMM and controller aim assist. You cannot "just have fun" in this game anymore, Let's also talk about the real reason that the game is in the state it is. Streamers. They complain if the game isn't exactly how they want to play it, they complain if the game isn't tuned for slide cancels and crack-head movement speed. They spend their entire lives playing this game and spawn armies of sheep, using the same broken guns and loadouts. Spreading like a cancer across this game. I just can't enjoy this game anymore. Let's not even mention then 5 hour campaign. Activision, you suck and the worst thing you did for COD was warzone.

MW2 Original Review:
Not a good launch for multiplayer/base game. Campaign was great and the availability to play early. Graphics are stunning, once you figure out the right settings. 
Multiplayer on the other hand is another story. 
-Constant crashing (10 times within an hour - doesn't include my team). Also.have to verify files afterwards. 
-No hardcore - i mean Tier 1 - mode. But wait, "its coming." Nothing saves - loadouts, calling cards, etc. 
-The menu is still clunky and obnoxious. Makes you click a billion times in and out to find what you are looking for. 
-Have to restart my game 3 times when I first launch in order to get things going. Needs lots of work in order to be considered a smooth game. 
-Can't see any rewards that are being used (xp) 

I will give the benefit of the doubt and wait I guess. Also. game crashed constantly and have to verify files. so far 4 times less than an hour. It's a game now who we bet will crash first. 

MW2 UPDATE review: It has come a long way since release with fixing the not being able to party, and crashing to adding hardcore (tier1) but I don't understand how games can continue to release games unfinished, and unpatched for weeks. Games still CRASHES, things still break (currently can't redeem the battle pass tokens). We've had two patches and one was for the new content release. But pretty much like the previous CODs with removing/adding new game modes, limiting the maps to those specific game modes - the usual. I don't play warzone so can't comment on that but the new mode DMZ is an interesting take (if warzone and tarkov had a baby) but toxic players and hacks everywhere you go

If you have been a die hard fan, you'll probably like it - just need to continue the patching and please, LISTEN TO YOUR PLAYERS. Still don't think it was worth $70.

Genuinely my favourite Call of Duty in a long time - The classic map nostalgia is definitely carrying so weight, but I genuinely feel like this is what I grew up playing should feel like in the modern era. I personally love the return of the War game mode, one of my favourites from WWII, and the camo grind is a fun challenge to strive for (I may have already finished the base part of that, oops!)

The new Zombies option is not the classic style everyone is looking for, and I can fully acknowledge that. I like it a lot having a PvE twist to the Warzone style map, and I fully enjoy it and have sunk a ton of time into it too, but if you want the more classic style of maps and easter eggs for zombies, you definitely want to look somewhere else. I strongly recommend the Zombies Edition of Bo3, especially with the mod tools being available on steam, if that's what you are looking for instead. Otherwise, this is a new take, and worth trying out!

Should you buy this game?

Only if you've been itching to play a CoD game and haven't played in a while. I stopped playing COD after Black Ops 2. Bit the bullet on this rip-off of a game and, well... it's CoD. It's everything I expected. Although I used to enjoy the campaigns, I since became a sweaty multiplayer instead so that is what I care about. Frankly, I can't hate it too much. There's hella bugs that they should eternally be reminded and ashamed of, but it's CoD. It scratched the itch. If you bought 2019 and MW2, I wouldn't blame you for skipping this. I would have too.

Update: Now that the itch has been scratched, I can think clearly now and realize this game does not live up to the original experience. In addition, Activision and their greed knows no end and has ruined the game with EOMM. This is my last COD purchase ever.

What a weird system seemingly made to help circumvent Steam. Well Activision, if you wanna funnel all my opinions of CoD into one store page, then I will likewise funnel them all into one review:

$70 is too much for any game, let alone MW3, a game that relies heavily on recycled assets with almost no gameplay improvements outside of QoL and class customization. These things used to be given for free as updates in games circa 2010-2015 but now they slap a huge pricetag on it and call it a new entry. This isn't even an overpriced DLC, it's an overpriced "Stuff we should have added to MW1 years ago but instead drip fed to you via 3 sets of battle pass seasons".

The zombies mode is laughable. Every year, CoD Zombies fans ask for a new round-based mode like Black Ops 1, 2, or 3. Every time this gets strayed from, people say it sucks. The less effort put into it, the worse it is received. On the high effort, high change end, is Extinction in Ghosts, which has a cult following even now. On the opposite end is an ever increasing extreme: Black Ops 4? Panned for being too arcadey. Outbreak? No tension and recycled BR maps. Vanguard? No tension and recycled MP maps. And now this? This is Outbreak #2. Legit 90% of the playerbase in Outbreak played it because it was easy to grind XP and camos in. The same goes for MW3 zombies. Nobody will remember half the cast of MW3 zombies in 2 years. Nobody.

Multiplayer is good. But again, the leap from MW2 to MW3 here is a better customization mechanic and some QoL. Sequels should be better, this is the bare minimum. 

Campaign is terrible. Bad story, bad writing, repetitive gameplay reusing BR maps that were designed and modeled 3 years ago. There's not much to say here because there's not much content to actually discuss.


If you think paying $70 for a game with less content than games had 15 years ago is fine, and you agree with FOMO battle passes that turn games into jobs, and you like paying $20 for a single weapon skin, awesome, this game is perfect for you. Just make sure to remember your helmet when you go outside and stop eating so much glue.

Trash hit detection. SBMM still in the game even after everyone has demanded that it be taken out. SB hit detection absolutely exist despite what the idiots at Activision say. COD is dead. Game is uninstalled for god. Will not be coming back. Can't wait to watch the player base drop even further and hope for all bad things to happen to activision and blizzard.

Ha 69 hours, nice. If you liked Modern Warfare 2019 you'll definitely like this game, earned camos can be used on all weapons and it is WAY easier earning gold camos for guns in this game. I've already gotten platinum for the knife, riot shield, and all the shotguns, and earning gold for 8 assault rifles and all of the battle rifles is easy. I already have half of the smgs with gold camos, I'd recommend just playing a lot of shipment if you want to level up your guns FAST! Overall a fun experience with friends! Definitely use a controller if you can, it's a lot easier, but that might just be because I played modern warfare 2019 on xbox. Overall a solid game with a lot of free customization options that are actually good which I like a lot.

Edit: For the most part, Modern Warfare 3 has been a general upgrade to everything they had in Modern Warfare 2, however after purchasing Vault edition, which is advertised to come with blackcell, the game seems to be unsure of if you have blackcell or not. It comes with the 50 tier skips as advertised, but rather than blackcell adding anymore tier skips or none at all, the game instead doesn't let you progress past the number of tiers that would've come with blackcell. My battlepass has been stuck at tier 80 since December 22nd or so, and I've only recently managed to get it to tier 81 with a tier skip from the current The Boys event, with no further progression past that point. I'm not sure if it's like a steam issue where they didn't set up blackcell to come with vault edition so you have them separately, or if it's something to do with vault edition itself, but I'd be cautious of buying vault edition, since I have friends with normal Modern Warfare 3 that have been able to finish their battlepasses with no issue. I'd recommend the game again if they fix this issue, but until then I'd say hold off on buying it.
Edit: They fixed the battlepass issue yesterday! I was able to make progress again, which kinda sucked for having only 6 days to finish it, but I'm on tier 95 after using tier skips and zombies so it's not a big deal. And Zombies is just absolutely amazing in this game, I met a team of complete strangers that helped me through the elder sigil and got me all three of the highest tier blueprints in the game, which was very nice of them.

Have 20+ years experience with the franchise and this is an all time low. The multiplayer was enjoyable until you get some time in and their patented matchmaking formulas destroy your experience with no control on your end. Skill based matchmaking and engagement based matchmaking are entirely cancerous to the game and people who passionately play the game. Its worse than a casino where if you do well, you are punished and therefore basically robbed of any form of fun at every turn. Bugs and little issues are nothing compared to this sort of garbage. It makes the game unplayable after you have enough time in the game or play well enough. If call of duty is what you want. just go play the original cod 4, cod 5, mw2, or black ops. since those servers have been revived. Im not sure if they have implemented the same sort of matchmaking garbage there but its far more worth your time and money than this travesty. The Demise of the Franchise. I hope that when call of duty dies that this sort of rigged matchmaking dies with it.


Follow up,

There is another large issue with the game that has Nothing to do with pc hardware upon large in depth investigation. The game has no optimization, and eventually the game will literally force reboot your pc mid game or at menu making the game entirely unreliable and unplayable. i managed to get a couple hundred hours in before it was an issue for me. however, ranging from low end to top of the line hardware there are thousands of people online in threads trying to trouble shoot and identify a fix for this issue. Nearly all of the experts in these threads have been able to identify that it is indeed on the Call of duty side of things and there is nothing wrong or to be done on the individuals hardware. Call of duty has still not acknowledged this issue since the release and the issue has only become more prominent. Its unreal. Unfortunately as much as id like to continue playing the game. i literally cannot and its due to no error or miscalculation on my part. I truly hope they can figure this stuff out.

Another follow up.

Fixed the pc breaking issue by uninstalling every video adapter driver on the computer. which is ridiculous and was triggered by the game itself as there are threads with 1000 plus people suffering from the same thing without a fix. and still the company lies about how things work and fire large portions of their development teams. Riddled with bugs and exploits and is entirely not fair. Things like the broken aim assist doing all the work for controller players where mouse and key get nothing. They lie about skill based and engagement based functions of their game when proven that they are lying time and time again. Its sad to see. Games with the smallest of exploits like apex legends, once the studio and developers catch wind of the issue, it is the very next day that it is fixed and comes along with an entire breakdown of the issue and what was done to fix it, absolute transparency. While cod is just being made a laughing stock as they have far more resources to do this but just simply refuse and sit quietly and release a new bundle with a weapon skin hoping they just buy it and shut up. This will be the last call of duty for me. i hope the fps community will just boycott and let the franchise die so we can remember it for what it was 10 years ago.

I'm actually surprised with the campaign.
I thought this was going to be really low effort, bad and short according to release reviews but I was wrong. You can see all over the place that this was planned as an premium DLC with those combat free missions that feel really out of place, but otherwhise, it was really solid campaign compared with MW2 (2022) which had a super underwhelming singleplayer. 

I gotta recognize that Call of Duty achieved an amazing cinematics quality that are very enjoyable. This saga has one bullet more in the camber (MW4) to be seen a few years and if they wanna keep it alive, they gotta start writting a new story with new characters and let 141 rest forever without hurting the legacy of such a legendary saga for those who we've been able to enjoy the OGs back in the day and the reboots nowadays. 

I don't support this "pay again" strat from Activision, so, I only recommend it with 33% or 50% discount. Otherwise, skip it unless you can afford full price. 

TLDR: Just buy it at discount (33 or 50%) unless you can afford the full price cus you wanna play the campaign.

This game is really fun when it actually opens and works correctly, unfortunately that's only happened about twice since I've had it. I've probably spent more time trying to make the game actually open and work than I've spent actually playing. No matter what I try, when I open the game it'll load through the opening then show me a pop-up saying "Restart required to update", but after the 'update' the game doesn't open back up. When clicking the file to open it after said update, it just does the same thing with the pop-up. It's a constant loop. I've tried every fix I've found online, I've uninstalled and reinstalled my game multiple times, I've cleared cache and checked the file for corruptions; but it just will not play. The two times it's actually worked have been a rare, one-off thing and the game works as soon as I open it those times. The last time I made the game run correctly, it kicked me out after about 5 hours of playing and started the same loop again.

TL:DR Recommended because I wanted a decent, modern FPS, looks good, sounds good. 

The overall experience however is NOT recommended because of the hoops and loops needed to play just one single player story campaign.

Large file download simulator ✅
Current size : 176GB
Shader optimizer simulator ✅
Application (waiting for s*** to get done) reset simulator ✅

So I downloaded 176GB again. 

Once I clicked play on Steam, I was greeted with adverts for battle pass with no actual clear way of escaping. You are taken directly to multiplayer with free battle pass active. 

Once I figured out how to escape that money pit trap, I had to deal with three EULA, that you must read lol before being allowed to click accept, what the actual F***! 

I tried to play MW2 campaign (Modern Warfare 2) which is now classed as DLC for this horrendous mess of a software package. Nope. Have to wait for the whole package to update itself, here's an idea how about you let us download the whole thing from the start so we don't have to go through all this crap, you lazy MF's??? 

After being taken back to desktop and then the software restarted itself, I had to wait for the MP shader's to finish before I could click on MW2 and then scroll to the campaign. A warning appeared saying this may take some time before you guessed it, the whole thing reset itself and I was back on Steam again. Several seconds later I'm back inside the software again, this time at the MW2 menu, now waiting for SP shaders to finish, by which point I was fed up of waiting so I quit out.

[b]WILL PROBABLY HAVE TO GO THROUGH ALL THIS CRAP AGAIN WHEN I WANT TO PLAY MW3 CAMPAIGN BECAUSE ITS PART OF THE SAME F'd up package.[/b]


[b]Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 remake review.[/b]

Single player only review, because I loathe PVP.
Graphics, voices & lingo, sounds and atmosphere, very well done, 5/5 ⭐
Story/plot? good guys vs bad guys, who cares? I get to play with guns in a FPS.

Bugs.
Being told to wait for your squad that does not move, ever. 
I watched the crops grow before switching it off.

However, putting all the games (Modern Warfare 2, Modern Warfare 3, Vanguard, Warzone) together in a launcher you have no choice over and have to wait for shaders to optimize or the app to reset (back to desktop/steam) whilst you move around the various games/scenarios is not a good idea. 

Saying that, it's still better than having to open that crappy EA app before you click play on steam.
 
[b]*Take note EA*[/b]

[b]*After this review has been edited, I welcome EA with open arms after this mess[/b]

I regret to say that my experience with Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 on Steam has been nothing short of disheartening, primarily due to the persistent issue of unwarranted shadowbans. As a dedicated player who genuinely enjoys competitive gaming, I find it necessary to share my concerns to enlighten potential buyers about the challenges they may encounter.

The game's lack of an effective anti-cheat system has resulted in a frustrating cycle of being reported for performing well in matches, subsequently leading to recurring five-day shadowbans. It is evident that the current mechanisms in place are insufficient to discern between genuine skill and illicit activities, leaving players like myself caught in the crossfire of these arbitrary penalties.

Despite my genuine efforts to engage in fair and competitive gameplay, the constant threat of being shadowbanned has significantly impacted my overall enjoyment of the game. It's disheartening to invest time and effort into a title only to face hurdles that hinder the very essence of fair competition.

As a loyal fan of the Call of Duty franchise, I had hoped for a more comprehensive and reliable anti-cheat solution in Modern Warfare 3. However, the recurrent shadowbans have left me questioning the efficacy of the system and my willingness to continue supporting the game.

Given the ongoing challenges and the lack of assurance that this issue will be resolved satisfactorily, I cannot recommend Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 on Steam to potential buyers. Until the developers implement a more robust anti-cheat system, players may find themselves grappling with the frustrating cycle of shadowbans that diminish the joy of competitive gaming.

In conclusion, my experience with Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 has been marred by the absence of an effective anti-cheat system, leading to frequent and undeserved shadowbans. Until these issues are adequately addressed, potential buyers may want to reconsider their investment in this title.

As always the gunplay in CoD games is best it could be, I like that they introduced earning your perks, I like the new leap mechanic.

That's all of the positives though. The fact that they force you to download it along Warzone is just absurd. On top of that I have a feeling (since MW 2019) that warzone gets much more attenion that the game you actually paid for. There's plenty of maps from old MW2 included in the warzone map, right there, ready to be implemented into multiplayer - but no, all we get is 10 mediocre maps that we're forced to play forever. The battlepass idea is just absurd - you pay a lot of money (on top of the base game which is also expensive af) so you can get the new stupidly overpowered guns before FTP players do. If you decide not to buy it you can get it by grinding for months after the weapons have been nerfed several times. The game just seems unfinished and doesn't get enough attention compared to warzone (WHICH I HAVENT PAID FOR AND DONT WANT). The developers just want to milk you for as much money as they can and it's getting more disgusting every new title. Shame what they did to CoD. Also the UI seems like solving a puzzle each time I want to change gamemode or weapon attachments. Don't forget the shop stuff thrown at your face each time you enter the game :)

Edit: It's got worse, I came back after a while, now I've just spent 20 minutes trying to launch Raid mode. Enter HQ. Accept new regulations. Configure settings. Unskipable cutscene. Update requires restart. Optimizing shaders. Switch from HQ to MW2. Configure settings again lmao. It takes forever to just start playing. How can you make the game so unapproachable. Just let the man play??

I mean, game is okay. It's fun, but not worth the money. Activision paid a BUNCH of DIFFERENT companies to host their servers, leading to horrible connectivity issues and crashing, even with 400+ mbps and Open NAT Type.

for a call of duty game its alright, it has great graphics and decent game play, but for a new game it feels old just with some shiny paint.

Edit: when i say the game is decent to play i mean the "new" zombies gamemode that "totally" isn't just a re-skin from dmz and cold wars open world zombie gamemode was pretty fun to play if you had friends to play it with but it wasn't a new mode it just had a new story and a different map. the story looked nice and it was interesting to have open map missions on a call of duty game but it felt empty and short. i like the 150 hp over the cods standard 100 hp and the new movement system to help assist the player into outplaying there enemy it was very fun especially with a knife running around the map in atypical places and stabbing your foes. 

TLDR: if you get this game at a discount and you haven't played many call of duty games sure go for it, but i can't say its worth full price since its just a mw2 remaster update that was given a new name and story. (i pre ordered the 100usd game i did not get if for a discount sadly)

The COD HQ thing is absolute trash. First open the HQ, "update requires restart". restart the HQ. Navigate the HQ to find MW2. It closes the HQ and Launches MW2. MW2 "update requires restart". Restart MW2.
All these extra steps for what??? When I want to play MW2, I want to be able to click on MW2 in steam, you know, the place where i have a list of all my games! If I wanted to play MW3, I would click on MW3. Is that so complicated??? But no, I have to download a bunch of crap for games that I don't even own, just so it can suck my storage space and get in my way. 
It's sad, Call of Duty used to be awesome. Now, it's not even a shell of its former self. I am sorry to any of you younger players, that you never got to experience how great COD could really be.

Imagine looking to buy a car. The same car you've had for years, but a newer model. You're talking to the dealer and he is very clear about all the terms/conditions, price, blah blah blah, boring jargon, and fine print. It all sounds really good. He is very transparent. You take it for a test drive and it's smooth. Once you get back to the dealership, you hand over the money and sign the papers, he hands you the keys. He walks you out to the parking lot and gets you in the car. Before you know it he has sprinted back into the dealership, locked the doors, turned off the lights, pulled the window blinds down and peeks out from in between them. You start the car and pull out of the driveway and get a mile down the road and the car quits. You call the number for the dealership and immediately receive the automated message: "We're sorry you have reached a number that has been disconnected or is no longer in service. If you feel this is in error, please check the number dialed, and please try again." You are frustrated. You walk back to the dealership and it is just an empty lot. No building, no cars, no banners, nothing. This is my experience.

fuck this game

Although I still play it, this game always finds a way to cheat the player. They no longer reward skill. Instead, the game goes based off of making it fair for everyone. I have been in many situations where I should have died in the game, but instead came out beating the other player even though they had all the advantage regarding positioning, firepower, movement, and health. However I came out beating the other player and vice versa. The developers are constantly nerfing and buffing weapons instead of allowing the player to have more control of how they play. for example, if you are a really good sniper and prefer to play with a sniper, there are times when the developers remove firepower from snipers and instead, make assault rifles more powerful than snipers. There is also this thing called aim assist that only helps controller players. Now you are forced to play the in a different manner, getting closer to the enemy. That is something that I do not agree with. I enjoy utilizing all types of weapons. However, it becomes a problem when the developers add a new weapon into the game. Sometimes you have to purchase the weapon in a bundle, or unlock it. Then you have to level the weapon up to be able to use attachments, of change the skin. The developers also constantly remove and add new game modes. This limits players because not every player enjoys all the game modes. Basically, The developers have full control of how they want everyone to play. You can not play the way you want to play. I am not the best or even close to being a pro, but I have played Call of Duty for many years now and have done some incredible things that remind me I can keep up with most players. With that being said, you can have lots of fun playing. Just remember, the game controls everything that happens. When you fight a less experienced player, it will make sure the fight is fair by providing assistance with aiming, movement, and positioning. Sometimes you can be right on target and your shots will not register. Sometimes the weapon you are using will just feel weaker all of a sudden, or your health will diminish quicker. Basically, the developers have a way of trying to please everyone by not pleasing anyone. I have been top performer in many matches, low performer, and mid performer and have seen it all. I will not recommend this game. It is not fair to those that actually have some skill. For those are new, remember, you have to learn some things before you can be competitive just like anything else in life.

TLDR; If you only like MP, Get IT... but only on sale. 

Multiplayer
MW3 multiplayer is a truly fun overall experience. One of the best new-age cods. If you played MW2 (2009), you'll love reliving those past memories through the remastered maps. If you're new to the maps, most are very fun and easy to understand with a few outliers. They've also added original maps throughout season 1 and are planning many more in the future. Each OG map Sledgehammer has created is leagues better than Infinity Ward has made since COD GHOSTS or MW3 (2011) Tons of guns, attachments and streaks to use to play how you want, with your own style. It's unfortunate this game has an unforgivably, terrible campaign, worst in franchise history. I believe if this game came out at 50 dollars and had no campaign, its player base would be booming. MW3 MP is what everyone wanted out of infinity wards game last year. An improvement on all fronts. Maps, Modes, Streaks, Balancing, Weapon Tuning, you name it. Truly feels like an old school MP experience. With most games having verbal interactions between players too.... If you know what I mean. Every community has something for them here. Even trickshotting has made a comeback. 

MP 9/10 without EOMM/SBMM. 8/10 with it. 

Zombies
I'm pleasantly surprised by how fun the new zombies mode is. It's a refreshing take on slaying the undead. It's replayability isn't anything to right off about but there are different challenges and a world boss to take on as of 1/29/2023. The mode shares the Warzone map Urzikstan as its fighting ground. Though, unlike Warzone, no future content/maps have been announced.

Z 6.5/10

Warzone
If you loved Warzone during the pandemic and Warzone 2 didnt resonate with you, I think Warzone 3 is worth the try. Urzikstan is your traditional larger map with plenty of POIs to loot and fight over. It has a great layout and flows pretty well. I enjoy it more than the original Verdansk.

WZ 8.5/10

Sledgehammer again delivers with an amazing Multiplayer experience held back by whoever is calling the shots at Infinity Ward or Activision. Communication with players is still franchise leading. A dev team who truly seem to care about what players want and are willing to compromise as much as they can. Unfortunately, its being reported that approx. 25% of the team has been let go. Sad to see them get blamed again for incompetent leadership and corporate greed. Its yet to be seen if XBOX/Microsoft will steer this ship out of the storm or sink with it.
